result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis D Vial was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days. Court authorized payment plan.

Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward anyone.
Random UA & BA testing at minimum of every 2 weeks. DNA on file.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Travis D Vial in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Travis D Vial.  Attorney Will Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea ct 1. 2 years probation. Argument. Statement by DE. DNA on file. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #   1
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for  2 years, cc to 20CF896

CONDITIONS:

-Not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-No threats/acts of violence against: Anyone

-Random UA and BA testing at a minimum of every 2 weeks
-DNA on file

-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent

Ct # 1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved
